website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for those who want a model that closely approximates the size of the adult mouth.
pros: Ships with a toothbrush to enhance the value
Bottom jaw pulls forward, making it easier to point out individual teeth and to learn how to brush the back of the teeth
Lower teeth are slightly spaced apart, allowing practicing of flossing
cons: A little small for classroom demonstrations

customer_reviews.title: They loved the hands on lesson
customer_reviews.text: I bought these teeth to teach my homeschooled children proper teeth brushing and flossing technique (since most public kindergartens cover this). They loved the hands on lesson! The bottom teeth are flossable and even pull out (attached by elastic) so you can show what a tooth looks like below the gum line. Great teaching tool. I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for teaching small kids
customer_reviews.text: The state of Texas decided to take health standards in the Kindergarten curriculum this year and I needed something for Chlildren’s Dental Health month. This did not disappoint! The bottom teeth pull up and allow you to see how deep teeth go and what they look like inside your gums. The bottom portion also allows room for flossing.
customer_reviews.author: Bek

customer_reviews.title: Barely Adequate
customer_reviews.text: As a dentist, I used my previous large tooth model on a daily basis when I explain the importance of brushing and flossing properly. After many, many years it began to look very worn and eventually started to crack and break apart. So I was forced to buy another large model. This product is so poorly made that the teeth don't even come close to occluding together. Cheap material. Flimsy. The toothbrush is probably worth the same amount as the typhodont.
customer_reviews.author: DctrLaw

customer_reviews.title: Missing some teeth. Lol.
customer_reviews.text: Good for brushing teeth demonstration only. There are several teeth missing which is highly inaccurate. The front teeth don't look like the human front teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Texan Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a dentist. I bought these for a presentation I have to give to toddlers for school about dental hygiene and they are amazing! I just love them. Fun and very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: My husband’s wife

customer_reviews.title: Nice teeth model!
customer_reviews.text: Great for teaching little kids how to brush! It comes with a toothbrush. The lower teeth are semi removable, with a little rubber bands that put them back in place. The teeth shows one root and the premolars and molars two.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good for a practicing student
customer_reviews.text: Great for my dahter studying to be a dental assistant.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Needed it for a demonstration on tooth brushing and flossing for a kids summer program. It worked well.
customer_reviews.author: The way it is. . .

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for children at school. They loved playing with it. The Tooth can be pulled out easy.
customer_reviews.author: Eliel Polanco

customer_reviews.title: Great Teaching Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bough this to teach my kids how to floss properly and improve their brushing technique and it is wonderful
customer_reviews.author: CalSurfer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: One of our hygienists wanted a large demo dent to use for young patients that was simple. Proper brushing techniques are easy to demonstrate and flossing can be demonstrated on the mandibular teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndia63

product_meta.title: Easyinsmile Large Dental Teeth Model with Removable Lower Teeth Patient and Student Model, Tooth Model Toothbrush Color is Random
